result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan D Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must have no contact with MLD d/o/b 02-07-2007
Must have no contact with  LLD d/o/b 02-23-2009
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
10/19/2016 CORRECTED FROM MUST HAVE NO CONTACT WITH DUSY R. TO MUST HAVE NO CONTACT WITH DUSTY R..

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent which should include a psychological evaluation and counseling for domestic violence. Must complete counseling with Vantage Point. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if the Defendant is revoked from Probation.
Court orders 100 hours of community service for each year on probation for a total of 200 hours.

Clerked by CS. 
Defendant Bryan D Daniels in court with attorney Richard W. White.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF517 & 15CM508 are tracking.
8:20 Court in session to address impeachment issues of defendant's witnesses.  Court orders if witness, Jeremy Y., testifies the answer shall be he has been convicted of 2 crimes.  Court orders if witness, Jeremey K., testifies the answer shall be he has been convicted of 4 crimes.  Both witnesses to have no further inquiry.  Court orders if witness, Robert M., testifies the answer shall be has been convicted of  2 crimes.  Exhibit 4 facebook page marked for identification by Attorney White - Court orders unredacted exhibit be used.
8:29 Jury Trial in session with jurors.  Bryan Daniels called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  Attorney White marks for identification exhibits 1 - 6 and 6A - 8.  All exhibits offered and received by Court.
9:14 Cross by State.  9:40 Court excuses jury for sidebar.  Argument by Attorney White.  Court rules on allowable cross examination.  9:44 Court recesses.  9:53 Court resumes with jury.  Last objection prior to going off the record has been sustained.  Continued cross by State.  10:04 Redirect by Attorney White.  10:04 Recross by State.
10:06 Jeremy Y., called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  Cross by State.  10:21 Court recesses.
10:33 Court in session.  Robert M., called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  10:36 Cross by State. 10:49 Defense rests.
10:50 D.R. recalled, sworn and direct by State.  11:02 No cross.  Testimony closed.  Jury excused.  Jury instructions reviewed on the record.  State offers and receives exhibits 9 - 11.
11:19 Jury Trial resumes with jury.  Instructions read to jury by Court.
11:34  Jurors excused.  Exhibits will go to the jury.  11:37 Court recesses.
12:35 Jury Trial resumes.  Closing Statement by State.  1:05 Closing Statement by Defense.
1:33 Rebuttal by State.  1:41 Closing jury instructions given by Court.
1:46 Bailiff sworn.  Jurors leave to begin deliberation.
1:48 Court recesses.
3:13 Jury returns with verdict.
Not guilty
Defense moves to accept verdict of jury and release from bond.
No obejction by State.
Court grants defense motion and dismisses case.

Clerked by SM. 
Defendant Bryan D Daniels in court with attorney Richard W. White.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF517 & 15CM508 are tracking.
8:22 Clerked by Rochele W.
State's Motions in Limine discussed and Court makes findings. Witnesses are to be sequestered before opening statements. Defense stipulates to a accept a verdict being returned with less then 12 jurors. Court will not empanel an alternate juror. Parties stipulate to waive a public trial. 8:45 Court in recess.
Sharon M., Clerk
8:53 20 jurors seated.  8:57 Court in session.  8:58 All jurors sworn.  Court voir dire.  Private Court voir dire.  9:49 State voir dire.  9:57 Objection by Attorney White.  Argument outside presence of jury.  Court sustains objection.  No questioning on facts of case.  10:04 Court reconvenes with State voir dire.  10:09 Defense voir dire.  10:12 Court voir dire.  10:13  Peremptory strikes made and preliminary jury instructions given by Court.  10.:22 12 jurors sworn.  10:24 Jurors excused and Court recesses.  State has some issues regarding limitations of voir dire.  Attorney White relates prohibiting Investigator Thompson from stating his beliefs of credible witnesses.  All agree.
10:53 Court in session outside presence of jury.  Jurors will be allowed to take notes during trial.  10:55 Jury returns to courtroom.  Opening jury instructions given by Court.  10:59 Opening statement by State.  Opening statement by Defense.
11:30 D. R., called, sworn and direct by State.
11:53 Rochele W., Clerk
12:01 Objection by Attorney White.
12:02 Jurors excused for lunch. Court held outside the presence of the jury.  Admonition will be given upon jurors return. 12:07 Court in recess.
1:01 Court resumes outside of presence of jury.  1:08 Jury returns.  Court admonishes jury that objection before lunch has been sustained.
1:10 Direct examination by State continues.  1:12 Cross by Attorney White.  1:36 Redirect by State.  1:39 Recross by Defense.
1:40 Investigator Chad Thompson, RLPD, called, sworn and direct by State.  1:44 Cross by Attorney White.  1:46 Redirect by State.
1:47 Sabrina A., called, sworn and direct by State.  1:58 Direct by Attorney White.  2:01 Recross by State.
2:02 Court recesses.  2:30 Court resumes with jury.  State rests.
2:30 Bonnie W. called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  2:35 Cross by State.  2:38 Redirect by Attorney White.  2:38 Recross by State.  2:40 Redirect by Attorney White.
2:40 Denise J. called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  2:50 Jury excused.  State's objection addressed outside of jury regarding hearsay.  Argument by Attorney White.  Argument by State.  Court over-rules hearsay objection.  Witness Mr. Lee criminal history discussed and one conviction is to be stated, if asked the question.
3:00 Jury returns.  Direct by Attorney White continues.  3:02 Cross by State.  3:11 Court recesses.  3:30 Court resumes outside of presence of jury.  Defendant indicates he will testify.  Court advises defendants of his rights and accepts his right to testify as knowingly and voluntarily.
3:39 Dustin L. called, sworn and direct by Attorney White.  3:46 Cross by State.  3:59 Redirect by Attorney White.  3:59 Recross by State.  Court questions.  4:00 Jurors excused for day and instructed not to discuss case and to return at 8:15 AM.  4:01 Attorney White relates regarding the 6 exhibits he had marked.  Exhibit 4 is a facebook post from defendant and discussed.  Will be addressed tomorrow morning.  4:05 Court recesses.
Plea hearing on June 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Hearing at 06-15-2016 08:00 am.
